results.title: The Nugget
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, Jennifer Cluff, b j films, Macquarie Film Corporation and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Lotto, Wookie and Sue are three working class mates whose favourite pastime is to frolic in the outback on a futile hunt for gold, dodging the protestations of their spouses. One day however luck befalls the hapless trio when they happen upon a giant nugget of gold, making them instantly rich. Avarice soon takes over and former rock-solid friendships are torn asunder by rivalries and petty disagreements. Bill Bennett (Kiss or Kill, Spider and Rose) borrows from the set-up of John Huston’s “The Treasure of the Sierra Madre” (1948) but inverts the drama in favour of slapstick comedy, trading on Aussie movie cliches (redneck attitudes, colloquial banter, ockerism, boozing, mateship) familiar themes from such comedies as “The Castle”, “Welcome to Woop, Woop”, “Muriel’s wedding” and even “They’re a weird mob” to create an allegorical fable about the perils of wealth cast in a fun, lightweight, albeit highly predictable, manner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Bennett, Jennifer Cluff, b j films, Macquarie Film Corporation and Film Finance Corporation Australia

results.title: The Novo Castrian story: an impression of the Port of Newcastle, Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch and New South Wales. Maritime Services Board
results.brief_description: The port of Newcastle, N.S.W., its existing facilities and work on new wharf and reclamation developments. The life and major industries of the city and the Hunter Valley are shown briefly.

results.title: The Novel: early Victorian England and Charles Dickens
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines Victorian England, pointing out its startling contrasts of morality and hypocrisy, splendour and squalor, prosperity and poverty. Illustrates these points by enactments of episodes from Dickens’ novels.

results.title: The Note
results.brief_description:
This mature exploration of difficult relationships utilises understated camerawork to convey an assured and gripping narrative. Strong visual composition and the use of motif combine with an effective soundtrack to create a piece that does not underestimate the role of the audience.
Music composed and performed by Madeleine Jay. ‘Moonlight Sonata’ by Beethoven.

results.title: The Nostradamus kid
results.creator_credit: Bob Ellis, Terry Jennings and Beyond Films
results.brief_description: Ken Elkin (Noah Taylor) an over-sexed, hyperactive youth with a taste for personal melodrama, first encounters the end of the world at the annual Seventh Day Adventist Camp in 1956. Convinced by an eloquent heretic that all Adventists are to burn in hell the following Saturday, Elkin fears that his true love for the pastors’ daughter will never be consummated - but the world doesn’t end. Arriving in Sydney in 1962 to attend University, Elkin encounters the world’s end for a second time while besieging the wealthy and beautiful Jennie O’Brien (Miranda Otto) with his misguided affection. Believing that with the Cuba Missile Crisis the end of world is truly nigh, the paranoid Elkin persuades Jennie to flee Sydney for the safety of the nearby mountains. However, the much longed for apocalypse is once again postponed and he returns to face the wrath of Jennie’s father. Cast also includes Arthur Dignam, Jack Campbell and Erik Mitsak.

results.title: The Nose, throat and ears
results.brief_description: Describes the structure and functions of these organs. Shows that, although they are separate organs, they are all lined with a continuous mucous membrane and that infection in one may lead to infection in the others.
results.description: Describes the structure and functions of these organs. Shows that, although they are separate organs, they are all lined with a continuous mucous membrane and that infection in one may lead to infection in the others.

results.title: The Nose = Le Nez
results.creator_credit: Claire Parker, Alexandre Alexeieff and Cinema Nouveau
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Nicoli Gogol and drawn on pinboard, tells of a young man who unwittingly loses his nose at the barbers. After an unsuccessful and exhausting search, the nose is returned to him. Next morning he calls again at the barbers for a shave.
